header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 23, Volume II-11, July 1977
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Practical Magic

central_thesis: The astral plane is not an objective reality but a subjective construct of the human mind, a 'state of consciousness' that magicians can actively create and control through directed will and mental projection to achieve practical magical effects, including the creation of personal 'astral Temples' and mastery over time, without the need for physical ritual chambers.

structure_content.summary: This article redefines the astral plane as a subjective mental construct rather than an objective reality. It details 'astral projection' as a will-driven process of 'mental projection' to create and control a personal 'universe' or 'astral Temple,' enabling magicians to transcend physical limitations and linear time, thereby making physical ritual chambers unnecessary. The author critiques traditional views, aligning with a more subjective, mind-centric approach to magical practice.

The editor, Margaret Wendall IV°, reflects on the Temple of Set's publication, 'The Scroll of Set,' over the past two years, noting its growth and the personal satisfaction derived from its evolution into a 'total Setian experience.' She announces the transition of the editorship to Priest Michael J. Waters, emphasizing the communal effort and the concept of 'Xeper' (self-creation/evolution) within the Temple.
A short, poetic piece announcing the birth of 'Ian Seth,' reflecting themes of twilight, the setting sun, and the coming into being, framed within the Setian concept of 'Xeper'.

This section addresses reader inquiries. Paul S. Uriaz I° praises 'Operation On Call' for information exchange. John E. Renaud II° and James Lewis II° discuss the 'sex' of Set and HarWer, concluding that neither possesses a biological gender, viewing Set as a transcendent, 'ageless Intelligence' capable of assuming any form, and emphasizing individual conceptualization rather than dogma. They hint at HarWer's nature as an emotional force and buffer.

Richard D. Murad II° stresses the importance of continuous re-evaluation of beliefs and ideas within Setianism. He argues that true Setians, or 'Elect,' must constantly subject their ideas to rigorous logical and factual tests, never passively accepting doctrines, and seeing this critical process as fundamental to 'Xeper' and the worth of their beliefs.

A factual report on the mummy of Pharaoh Rameses II undergoing intensive radiation treatment in 1977 to combat insect and fungal infestations, highlighting the historical figure and the intersection of ancient artifacts with modern science.

Sandy Sarris II° reviews the film 'Star Wars,' praising its special effects. The review then analyzes 'The Force' in the movie from a Setian perspective, comparing its use to the magician's will. The author notes that Luke Skywalker's use of the Force is accidental and undeserved, contrasting it with a Setian's active, intentional direction of will and suggesting that true mastery requires evolution and understanding.

key_concepts.definition: According to Seago, it is not an objective place or higher vibratory level, but a 'state of consciousness' and 'product of the human mind' with no objective existence. Its varied nature is due to individual consciousness.

A 'total inversion' of normal sensory input, enabling the magician to 'create and control private universe of his own design.' It is a sophisticated form of 'mental projection' distinct from mere imagination by its degree of directed will and purpose.

An effort of will sufficient to 'literally forget the existence of the physical body and environment.' It involves creating from within, projecting one's 'sphere of attention' anywhere, and manipulating time.

The crucial element distinguishing effective mental projection from mere daydreaming. It enables the magician to control their internal universe and is the 'key' to using 'The Force' (in a magical context), contrasting accidental use with conscious application.

A core Setian concept of self-creation, becoming, and evolution. It is applied to the growth of the Scroll of Set, the continuous re-evaluation of beliefs, and the ultimate aim for individuals to 'Become'.

Described as a 'distinct, conscious entity,' 'Prince of Darkness,' and 'ageless Intelligence of this universe.' It is perceived as transcending biological gender, with its personification often for convenience rather than literal description, open to individual conceptualization.
Characterized as a 'strange and fitful presence,' an 'emotional force' acting as a 'buffer between the non-conscious and conscious reason.' Like Set, it is seen as transcending biological gender.

practical_system.description: The practical system is 'mental projection' or 'astral projection,' defined as the conscious, will-directed creation and control of a 'private universe' within the magician's mind. This involves an intense effort of will to dissociate from the physical body and environment, enabling creation 'from within' rather than reaction to external stimuli. The goal is to establish a personal, functional magical reality, such as an 'astral Temple,' for the performance of rituals and to gain control over subjective experiences, including time perception.
tools: Directed Will: The primary faculty, essential for initiating mental projection and maintaining control over the created reality.
Concentration Exercises: Precursor practices to develop the mental discipline necessary for deep projection (e.g., 'The Yoga From Yuggoth').
Imagination: Employed as the mechanism for creating the details of the 'private universe,' but guided and controlled by directed will to prevent aimless 'daydreaming'.
rituals: Mental Projection: Initiating a state where the magician 'literally forgets the existence of the physical body and environment' through an effort of will.
Creation of an Astral Temple: Constructing a detailed, personalized inner sacred space, complete with 'Daimonic servitors and familiars,' as a stable environment for magical work.
Performance of Rituals within the Astral Temple: Conducting magical operations entirely within the mentally projected environment, leveraging the created reality for specific magical aims.
Time Manipulation: Utilizing mental projection to accelerate or decelerate subjective linear time, allowing for complex experiences in compressed real-time durations.

relevant_quotes.text: This astral plane is so varied and so changeable that several clairvoyants looking at the same thing might give totally different accounts of what they saw; yet they might each make correct deductions.
the astral plane is actually a product of the human mind. It has no objective existence. The astral plane is not a place, but a state of consciousness.
Astral projection is a total inversion of this process, enabling the magician to create and control private universe of his own design.

Conventional concepts of linear time do not apply in mental projection, just as a tremendously complex dream may take place in only a minute or two. Far from a fixed law, time can be accelerated or decelerated by the magician.
I am the ageless Intelligence of this universe.

critical_analysis.relevance: The article 'Rituals Without Chambers' is highly relevant for practitioners of modern subjective magic and early forms of Chaos Magic. It predates many explicit Chaos Magic texts but articulates a core principle: the mind's ability to construct and manipulate reality for magical ends, divorcing practice from objective metaphysical structures. The entire issue provides a unique snapshot into the early philosophical and practical concerns of the Temple of Set, including self-evolution (Xeper), intellectual rigor, and cultural commentary, demonstrating a practical and adaptable approach to occultism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes Setian initiates and practitioners interested in the philosophical underpinnings and practical application of internal, will-driven magic. It also appeals to occultists questioning traditional, objective models of the astral plane, seeking to develop mental faculties for magical purposes, and those exploring the early development of modern esoteric organizations like the Temple of Set.
